column1: #Text=is on the west coast of Newfoundland , Canada .
#Text=A UNESCO World Heritage site , Gros Morne National Park protects an area of impressive natural beauty , rural Newfoundland culture , and unique geological wonders .
#Text=The park 's namesake mountain , Gros Morne , is the second highest point in Newfoundland at 806 metres .
#Text=Its French meaning is " large mountain standing alone , " or more literally " great sombre .
